intro: Meum siifolium, commonly known as yellow toadflax, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Violaceae and is characterized by its yellow flowers with purple veins. The plant has opposite, lance-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in disturbed soils and can often be found along roadsides and in meadows. Meum siifolium is known for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
